comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; de-DE; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: 

Follow up Bug 637005 comment 5

I got this issue when replaying / mail to a person who's certificate has more
than one email addresses shown in owner field at details tab of certificate
manager. The certificate is only found for the last listed email address:

For example the certificate with owner field

E = <deleted>.<deleted>@googlemail.com
E = <deleted>.<deleted>@web.de
E = <deleted>.<deleted>@gmx.de
CN = <deleted> <deleted>

is only found for mails going to <deleted>.<deleted>@gmx.de but not for mails
going to <deleted>.<deleted>@googlemail.com or <deleted>.<deleted>@web.de


Reproducible: Always



Expected Results:  
Certificate is used for all listed email adresses
comments.creator: dieter.grosshans@googlemail.com

comments.text:
(In reply to Wayne Mery (:wsmwk) from comment #3)
> > Whiteboard: dupme?
> 
> ludo do you have a bug# in mind?

No or else I would have duped and some duplicate cert are due to another field than the email address so I'm cautious on these issues.
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Wayne Mery (:wsmwk) from comment #3)

comments.text:
For info, this still appears to be a problem in 38.3.0 (running on MacOSX Yosemite).

In my case, I have a recipient with cert emails:
E = full.name@mydomain.com
E = nickname@mydomain.com

i.e. both email addresses are on same domain. I can send encrypted to the second, but not the first. Looks like Thunderbird is only taking recognising the last address. Presumably it's overwriting the entry in its certificate lookup each time it reads a line from the cert.
